alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 3:51AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...RAIN FREEZING ON ROAD SURFACES WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN BIG HORN AND CENTRAL SHERIDAN COUNTIES... A mix of light rain and snow will persist along the Bighorn foothills through mid morning. Where precipitation is rain, it is falling on frozen road surfaces creating black ice and difficult travel conditions. This includes portions of I-90 from Wyola south through Sheridan county. Be prepared for black ice and difficult travel conditions through this morning. Walking surfaces will also be slick so use caution to prevent slip falls. Delay travel if possible until conditions improve later this morning. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton, Lodge Grass, Fort Smith, Big Horn, Clearmont, Wyola, Parkman, Banner and Crow Indian Reservation. The freezing rain may quickly coat roadways with a thin layer of ice that may be undetectable. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
